DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Stage Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Severity Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of acute graft versus host disease upper gastrointestinal tract severity stage.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing within the first 100 days post-transplant, but with short duration.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.

Concepts.definition: Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Severity Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
